channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report X-2023061290
item.description:
Report X-2023061290

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-08
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THe closure of the outer packaging didn't failed causing the bottles to drop out. This damaged the caps where they became loose and caused spillage. DescribePack: the glued closure of the box failed completely and the caps of the bottles failed DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the area was cleared and the spill was cleaned up to be contained

item.title: Report E-2023060543
item.description:
Report E-2023060543

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: LAWRENCEVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NNC experienced a release from 5 boxes, each containing (4) 1-gallon poly pails of UN1760 "Sparclean Detergent II". ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-quarts of product released to the pallet. The pallet was wiped down and neutralized. All damaged boxes and jugs of product were placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023060542
item.description:
Report E-2023060542

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: CARTERSVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NRG experienced a UN2924 Calfon AS 300 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 40' x 1' area of the trailer floor onto the dock due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged drum along with another dented drum of the same material were each placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All cleanup debris including the impacted pallet were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023060398
item.description:
Report E-2023060398

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-01
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 1, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN3266 were damaged during a load shift and released approximately five (5) gallons to the trailer interior. R&L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to assess and remediate the site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents and absorbent pads to the impacted trailer and swept them in using hand tools. All spent absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum for disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver overfilled the customer's storage tank. This caused approximately 100 gallons of gasoline to be released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy driver opened a valve on the trailer prior to having the delivery hose connected to the customer's storage tank. This allowed approximately 50 gallons of gasoline to be released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

A member of QA isolated then relocated the package to hazardous material area. DescribePack: Once dropped, the cap was no longer securing the liquid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: A member of QA isolated and relocated the hazmat.

item.title: Report E-2023050664
item.description:
Report E-2023050664

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-26
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NAT experienced a UN1760 Liquid Acid Descaler release from a 5-gallon poly pail due to a pallet failure. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor and a 10' x 5' area of the concrete lot below. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged pail and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

The action taken was using quick absorbent to mitigate the spread while also placing the hazmat in a tote to prevent further spilling. DescribePack: The cap bent. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The action taken was using quick absorbent to mitigate the spread while also placing the hazmat in a tote to prevent further spilling. item.title: Report X-2023051128
item.description:
Report X-2023051128

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-17
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler was transporting package off of conveyor belt and during the process dropped the package. This led to a crack and subsequent break in the integrity of the bottle and spilled. QA was notified and a rep was sent to clean the spill with quick absorbent to prevent further spread. The package was then placed into a FedEx ground hazmat tote to prevent further uncontrolled spilling and the package was moved to the hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: A midline crack that eventually spiraled into a whole-body failure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Quick absorbent was used to clean up spillage and the hazmat was placed into a tote to prevent further spilling.

item.description:
Report E-2023050375

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-04
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 4, 2023, four (4) one-gallon pails of paint (UN1263) were damaged by a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Remediation Consultants (ERC) to remediate the impacted surfaces. ERC personnel restacked the non-damaged pails for continued shipping, then deployed degreaser and absorbents to the release. The crew then utilized hand tools to collect and containerize the four (4) damaged pails and all paint impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

When package was unloaded the top of the package was crushed and wet. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent pads were used immediately to stop the spillage from spreading. Hazmat package was placed inside Salvage drum to avoid spread.

item.title: Report X-2023050247
item.description:
Report X-2023050247

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-02
  • City: BRASELTON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023050247: SequenceEvent: TRAILER ARRIVED WITH HAZMAT LIQUID ON THE TRAILER BED. UPON INSPECTION, ALL 4 FOR THE BOTTLES INSIDE PACKAGE WERE CRACKED AROUND THE HANDLE AND TOP OF BODY, CAUSING LEAKAGE. IT APPEARS THAT THE DAMAGE ARRIVED AT OUR FACILITY AND HAPPENED WITHIN TRASIT OF THE TRAILER ARRIVEING TO US. SPILL WAS CLEANED WITH PPE AND PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION, ALL 4 FOR THE BOTTLES INSIDE PACKAGE WERE CRACKED AROUND THE HANDLE AND TOP OF BODY, CAUSING LEAKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL WAS CLEANED WITH PPE AND PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM. 2. X-2023050248: SequenceEvent: LEAKING HAZMAT FOUND ON DOCK. UPON INSPECTION THE CAPS ON THE INSIDE OF THE PACKAGE WAS LOOSE AND LEAKING. SPILL WAS CLEANED WITH PROPER PPE AND PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: THE CAPS ON THE INSIDE OF THE PACKAGE WAS LOOSE AND LEAKING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL WAS CLEANED WITH PROPER PPE AND PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM. 3. X-2023050249: SequenceEvent: LEAKING HAZMAT FOUND ON DOCK. UPON INSPECTION THE CAPS ON THE INSIDE OF THE PACKAGE WAS LOOSE AND LEAKING. SPILL WAS CLEANED WITH PROPER PPE AND PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: THE CAPS ON THE INSIDE OF THE PACKAGE WAS LOOSE AND LEAKING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL WAS CLEANED WITH PROPER PPE AND PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM.
